data.sampled: Max Loss = -$3.29. Max Gain = $6.21. ($-3.29, $6.21). The maximum possible loss (max loss) is calculated by subtracting the net credit received from the lowest striking price of the purchased options. In this case, the difference between the lower striking prices of the purchased puts (-$40 + -$42) minus the net credit received ($1.28 + 0.85), multiplied by 100 equals the max loss of -$3.29. The maximum possible gain (max gain) is calculated by adding the highest striking price of sold calls plus the net debit paid for the bought calls, minus the stock's current share price times 100. In this case, (+$48 + +$47) minus the current stock price of $45 times 100 equals $6.21. These calculations give us our final result of the min/max range of [-$3.29, $6.21].
